intro: Tiquilia latior, commonly known as the broadleaf tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a slightly hairy texture, and it often grows in rocky or sandy soils. Tiquilia latior is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in full sun.
